dt: {bc}curly endive leaves that have finely dissected edges and are used in salads {bc}{sx|curly endive||}

et: French, short for {it}chicorée frisée{/it} curly chicory
shortdef: curly endive leaves that have finely dissected edges and are used in salads : curly endive —called also frisée lettuce

dt: {bc}an aileron having a nose portion projecting ahead of the hinge axis and a lower surface in line with the lower surface of the wing

et: after Leslie George Frise †1979 English engineer and aircraft designer, who developed it
shortdef: an aileron having a nose portion projecting ahead of the hinge axis and a lower surface in line with the lower surface of the wing

dt: {bc}any of a breed of small sturdy dogs of Mediterranean origin having a thick wavy white coat

et: modification of French {it}bichon à poil frisé{/it} curly-haired lapdog
shortdef: any of a breed of small sturdy dogs of Mediterranean origin having a thick wavy white coat

dt: {bc}a defense consisting typically of a timber or an iron barrel covered with projecting spikes and often strung with barbed wire
{bc}a protecting line (as of spikes) on top of a wall

shortdef: a defense consisting typically of a timber or an iron barrel covered with projecting spikes and often strung with barbed wire
a protecting line (as of spikes) on top of a wall —usually used in plural
